document.docAuthor: Hielkema, Auke J. & Hielkema, Meindert A.
document.masterDocTitle: An annotated checklist of the Scarabaeoidea (Insecta: Coleoptera) of the Guianas

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An annotated checklist of the Scarabaeoidea (Insecta: Coleoptera) of the Guianas

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Hyboma orbignyi Blanchard 1846: 156
Note. Two presently recognized subspecies of
Deltochilum ( Hybomidium ) orbignyi
have been described, one of which occurs in the research area while the other one was thought to occur there due to misidentifications.

subSubSection.paragraph:
§ Subspecies
Deltochilum ( Hybomidium ) orbignyi amazonicum H. W. Bates, 1887

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Deltochilum amazonicum H. W. Bates 1887a: 37
( Peru - LECTOTYPE )

subSubSection.paragraph:
§ Subspecies
Deltochilum ( Hybomidium ) orbignyi orbignyi ( Blanchard, 1846 )

Distribution. Guyana :
Paulian 1938: 262 (as
D. ( Tetraodontides ) orbignyi
).
Suriname :
Paulian 1938: 262 (as
D. ( Tetraodontides ) orbignyi
). “Guianas”: Vulcano and Pereira 1964: 650 .
Brazil :
Vulcano and Pereira 1964: 650 ; Vaz-de-Mello 2000: 192 .
Venezuela :
Paulian 1938: 262 (as
D. ( Tetraodontides ) orbignyi
); Vulcano and Pereira 1964: 650 . Other: Blanchard 1846: 156 (Argentina - as
Hyboma orbignyi
); Gillet 1911b: 36 (Argentina); Paulian 1938: 262 (Argentina?, Bolivia, Colombia - as
D. ( Tetraodontides ) orbignyi
); Blackwelder 1944: 203 (Argentina); Vulcano and Pereira 1964: 650 (Bolivia, Colombia); Medina et al. 2001: 136 (Colombia); Noriega et al. 2007: 82 (Colombia); González-Alvarado and Vaz-de-Mello 2014: 448 (Argentina, Bolivia).

Note. According to González-Alvarado and Vaz-de-Mello (2014: 448) ,
Deltochilum orbignyi orbignyi
is restricted to Argentina and Bolivia . They state that the record of
D. orbignyi
for Colombia in Medina et al. (2001: 136) actually concerns
D. guildingii
. We suspect that all other records for the Guianas, Venezuela and Colombia of this species are also referable to
D. guildingii
. We have no proof for this though, and for now regard these records as misidentifications.
